item.title: readme
item.description: This part of website are some random notes I made for some advance mathematics courses I took.

item.title: complete
item.description: Def 14.2 A metric space is complete if every Cauchy sequence in X is convergent to some points in the set X.

item.title: Chebyshev interpolation
item.description: Definition interpolation on top of Chebyshev node Node The selection of node can be: Chebyshev–Gauss: x_j=\cos(\pi\frac{2j + 1}{2n}) Chebyshev–Lobatto etc Implementation it can be implemented by Lagrange Interpolation, orthogonal polynomial interpolation, and etc.

item.title: orthogonal polynomial interpolation
item.description: Concept basically in order to use orthogonal polynomial for interpolation, we setup the orthogonal polynomial coefficient matrix with selected polynomials and solve it for coefficients.

item.title: LU factorization
item.description: factorizing by A = LU where L is lower triangular and U is upper triangular matrix.

item.title: systems of first order ODEs
item.description: \vec x' = A\vec x briefly we need to find all Eigenvectors: find all Eigenvalues of the coefficient matrix A by solving \det(A - \lambda I) for each \lambda_i find (A - \lambda_i I)\vec \xi_i = \vec 0 where I is identify matrix and \vec\xi_i is correspond Eigenvector if the \lambda_i is repeate...

item.title: Abel's identity
item.description: for y'' + p(t) y' + q(t) y = 0 W(t) = W(y_1, \dots, y_n)(t) = c e^{-\int p(t)dt} where W is Wronskian determinant and c is a constant by W at convenient point.
